description:
The morning saw [b]the #8 Toyota losing up to a minute to the #51 Ferrari in the lead, before it lost all of it in the pits[/b], having to perform a full power cycle as the car would not restart. With the #8 Toyota seemingly on pace again, they tensely battled for almost 4 more hours before [b]the #8 Toyota crashed at Indianapolis[/b]. Although the Ferrari would have some more minor problems, [b]Toyota had lost too much ground to battle anymore[/b].
[b]The Cadillacs comfortably finished 3rd and 4th[/b], while [b]the #50 Ferrari managed to finish 5th[/b]. [b]The Glickenhaus cars dropped to 6th and 7th place[/b] because of crashes at the Indianapolis corner, and [b]the #93 Peugeot and #5 Porsche had mechanical problems[/b] that left them 8th and 9th.
